intro: Schmidelia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited Schmidelia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Schmidelia macrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
